title: Outbreak of Deadly Nipah Virus Confirmed In India | 10 News
description: Two cases of the deadly Nipah virus, carried by fruit bats and animals such as pigs, have been confirmed in India, with at least 190 people quarantined.  Indian officials have declared that the outbreak has been contained, while Thailand has beefed up its border controls in reaction to the outbreak in India.  The country has installed thermal scanners at major airports, with Thai officials stating there has been "no proof" of the virus entering Thailand, however they are "exercising caution as the Nipah virus is among the most dangerous contagious diseases".  The Virus can cause fever, brain inflammation and has a fatality rate rate of between 40% and 75%. title: Invasion Day Rally Bomb Scare Deemed 'Potential Terrorist Attack' | 10 News
description: Authorities are now investigating the alleged bomb attack at Perth’s Invasion Day rally as a potential terrorist act, after initially treating it as a hostile incident.  WA Police allege a 31-year-old man threw a device packed with screws, ball bearings and explosive liquid into a crowd of about 2,500 people in the CBD.  The device did not detonate, and no one was injured, but police described it as a potential mass-casualty event.  The Joint Counter Terrorism Team confirmed the reclassification followed growing concern over why the incident was not initially labelled terrorism.  First Nations leaders and organisers accused authorities of downplaying the attack, saying it would have been called terrorism if another group was targeted.  Police say investigations into motive are ongoing, with further charges not ruled out, and there is no ongoing threat to public safety. title: NBL Brawl Between Sixers And Bullets Spills Into Stands | 10 Sport
description: WILD SCENES in the NBL with the benches clearing in a scuffle between Adelaide 36ers and Brisbane Bullets players on the Gold Coast.  The brawl broke out after Bullets guard Hunter Maldonado got tangled up with Sixers big Nick Rakocevic, with the Bullets' Terry Taylor putting Rakocevic in a headlock.  Seven ejections were made after the incident, with the brawl referred to the league's Game Review Panel. title: French Alps Ski Resort Burns, Guests Evacuated | 10 News
description: More than 90 guests have been evacuated after a fire engulfed a five-star hotel in a French Alps ski resort on Tuesday night.  Over 130 firefighters were deployed to the scene, as a blaze took hold in the attic of Hotel des Grandes Alpes at around 7pm. Nearly 200 guests from nearby Hotel Le Lana were also evacuated Wednesday morning, as the fire continued to burn.  According to officials, no-one has been injured, and staff and guests have been taking refuge in other hotels.  Safety measures in the region remain under heavy scrutiny after a bar fire in the Swiss resort of Crans-Montana killed 40 and injured more than 100 on New Year's Eve.
